intro: Cracca varia, commonly known as the variable cracca, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Europe and western Asia, often found in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbrella-like inflorescences, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are usually lobed and can vary in shape depending on environmental conditions. Cracca varia is known for its adaptability and can thrive in a range of light and soil conditions.
